column4: so is anybody else willing to take a crack at my bizarre wired networking problem?
ask the channel and see
whats the chipset
lspci output to paste.ubuntu.com
if you can spot the single line then just type it here
does ifconfig show eth0
and what is the output of sudo dhclient eth0  (just tell us if there is a lease granted or not)
is that aforementioned link where i can get ethtool from? don't leave me bazhanging!

uh, it asks for my password and then what i type is invisible (which might be for privacy) but enter just gives me line breaks and then, shortly afterwards, a new prompt where previously there was nothing but line breaks.
and what happens when you try to ping www.google.com
thats odd. try bringing the device down then up again. sudo ifdown eth0 then ifup
barring that, could be a dns issue
how would it be a dns problem? i'm connecting to the internet plenty fine with 2 other computers
packages.ubuntu.com ?
no cursing please
sorry for cursing. what do i do next?
should we try messing with the network configuraqtion boxes now?
that card should work out of the box. perhaps using ethtool to see what it supports
could i burn ethtool onto a cd and unstall it like that?
by usb stick even
get it here? https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/natty/+package/ethtool
